@whoajordie excellent post about process. Sucks that idiots are idiots. Stay off the comments for your sanity.
@mercurialblonde Deadpool is one. Massive is usually another but not lately. Back when I used to color Rocketeer was one..
@mercurialblonde And..Manhattan Projects because the original "flats" that come back for that are a CRAZY rainbow. Like, insane sherbet.
@mercurialblonde And usually whatever is running so beyond late it's late and I'm working directly behind the artist.
@mercurialblonde Oh right, I missed this tweet! TOTALLY! Usually they are referencing ALL my work in high res so the decisions are-
@mercurialblonde -kinda informed my previous decisions I've made. BUT, I would say sometimes I hear Kelly say like, "Oh man - "
@mercurialblonde "-when you made that scene all pink like, I never thought pink. I thought blue. But you did something WEIRD. Cool!"
@whoajordie I've been digging the like hardcore primary color blocks from late 60s Godard stuff lately.  It chops up space in crazy ways
RT @mercurialblonde: @whoajordie do you know about this lady: http://t.co/cz9sKNIb1v ?
@whoajordie do you know about this lady: http://t.co/cz9sKNIb1v ?
@mercurialblonde this is so up my alley right now, it's stupid how up my alley this is. it is IN my alley going through the trash.
@mercurialblonde I'll follow her work wherever she goes if I can!
@whoajordie yeah it's prett-ty much heaven.  I don't know how much more there will be, because I think she's going to start working in film
@whoajordie @mercurialblonde Indeed
@mercurialblonde I'm in love with this. Thank you SO much for sharing!!!
@whoajordie it's such a crazy project because she just color corrects images in huge batches and then posts them in waves
@whoajordie and it's all contextual to the previous wave
@whoajordie so you can scroll down and it is really amazing
@mercurialblonde oh my goodness.
@whoajordie she basically does waves of black to white color shifts, and it's really inspirational to sift through
@mercurialblonde Hope you dig it. We try to play with white in it but I'm actually really into BLACK lately. Getting very bored of white.
@whoajordie I've only seen some of the previews.  I'm planning to read it.
@whoajordie my favorite white thing of yours that I've seen is actually the Captain Marvel issue with snow and dinosaurs I think
@whoajordie there's a really cool section where you kind of set up white really well and I was like drooling a little bit
@mercurialblonde So I'm guessing you've looked at Moon Knight? No one can stop talkin' about the white. Bluh. I'm like, meh.
@whoajordie you also get this powerful sense of white, which is my current color crush thing.
@mercurialblonde I might begin drooling over here.
@whoajordie and because it's so basic, the textural elements of the paint become more prominent
@mercurialblonde Well, I'm here whenever you wanna talk in a pub someday and talk color in films, comics and EVERYTHING!
@whoajordie I've actually been writing less about color than I would like.  I need to do more of it.
@mercurialblonde I dig it. That's my life! I do it ALL the time!
@whoajordie but pretty much all of my conversations with people end up going into color thoughts, whether it's film or comics
@mercurialblonde I've seen you go at it before! You're a analytical genius and  I love talkin' to those types! 'Cause I'm that type!! :)
@whoajordie Yes!  I need to go to more than one con a year or something.
@mercurialblonde One day we gotta chat it up in person.
@whoajordie I wish I had caught you at ECCC.  Talking about colors in comics is probbbbbably my favorite thing.
@mercurialblonde It kinda shows them they can open up past literal colors I think. Sometimes. Anyway, so much tweetin. SORRY!
@whoajordie It's also interesting to see this process like this, because you get to see two different people make color choices on something
@mercurialblonde It definitely does. I'm so frazzled 100% even though I change so much of what Kelly does she translates it so I can see!
@whoajordie it makes your own coloring choices more...seeable I think.  Because it's less of a whole big thing.
@mercurialblonde It's a curse for me but amazing to see them do so well so quickly. They learn about speed, scheduling and basic print stuff
@whoajordie yeah I would imagine they pick up a lot of knowledge very quickly, particularly if you're giving them feedback
@mercurialblonde And I do not currently have any assists now because I got them jobs coloring for real and now they are too cool. :(
@whoajordie Do your color assistant or assistants just work on one particular book each, or do they handle all of whatever number of books?
RT @whoajordie: Perhaps you don't know what "color assistant" means. http://t.co/GOf3D8vg4i
RT @whoajordie: Perhaps you don't know what "color assistant" means. http://t.co/GOf3D8vg4i
RT @whoajordie: Perhaps you don't know what "color assistant" means. http://t.co/GOf3D8vg4i
@elizabethamber Maybe...Tumblr ask? Or...just let me have it and I'll see if I can answer it in a concise, simple way?
@elizabethamber Oh man, because my "color corrector" takes WAY less time doing the color correcting than flatting.
@elizabethamber (not a stupid question, a very good question!) it costs me more in the long run to get the single page prepped but, guh.
@elizabethamber Oh no no! She's just tapping into that page and wizzin' around right quick bringing some sensibility to it all. :)
@elizabethamber Sure! Hope it was answered the question without being too, too lengthy! :)
@whoajordie Thanks for the clarifications.
@elizabethamber Yea those "first step" flatters take very little communication. :( some colorists work with flatters who do the 2nd step 1st
@whoajordie That's what stuck out. The woman on the right has a completely different uniform color than the final. Seemed like an odd step.
@elizabethamber Plus, color picking from my older pages to keep things consistent with colors I've chosen for like, a space or person.
@whoajordie  Oh. Ok. It seemed so vastly different. I thought the second step was gutting it all completely & starting over.
@elizabethamber I just don't have time to flat it myself and then correct crazy flats all by myself!
@elizabethamber Flatting can take like..1-2 hours depending on the page, maybe longer! But what Kelly does takes her maybe--10-20 minutes?
@whoajordie LOL no, just looking at that Deadpool pg. 1 & 2 are so different, why use a flatter?
@elizabethamber If you're gonna ask something like, why am I butthead or why do I even color comics I can just tell you, "I don't know."
@whoajordie I want to ask a question but I know the answer will be really long & I'll sound like an idiot.
